alert.note: Alert for Natrona County Lower Elevations; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued July 14 at 12:22PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MDT MONDAY... The following message is transmitted on behalf of the Wyoming Department of Environmental Quality, Air Quality Division, and the Wyoming Department of Health. * WHAT...Air Quality Alert for Wildfire Smoke. * WHERE...Lower Elevations of Natrona and Johnson Counties. * WHEN...Until 1 PM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Western Canada wildfires will spread moderate concentrations of smoke into northeast Wyoming given a persistent period of northwest wind aloft. HEALTH INFORMATION...The Wyoming Department of Health recommends that the elderly, young children, and individuals with respiratory problems avoid excessive physical exertion and minimize outdoor activities during this time. Wildfire smoke is made up of a variety of pollutants, including particulate matter and ozone, which can cause respiratory health effects. Although these people are most susceptible to health impacts, the Department of Health also advises that everyone should avoid prolonged exposure to poor air quality conditions. CURRENT CONDITIONS...The Wyoming Department of Environmental Quality, Air Quality Division offers near real-time air quality data for Wyoming`s monitoring stations and health effects information to help the public interpret current conditions. Current air quality conditions across the state of Wyoming can be found at http://www.wyvisnet.com/.
